file_content.text: Thank you again. You've kept the Republic's plans out of the Empire's clutches.
Excellent work. I knew we could trust you to fry those computers.
It's good to know who the Republic can count on. I'll be sure to put in a word for you with Command.
I'm just happy that the Republic's secrets are safe.
Glad I could help.
That makes two of us. I can't stress how important your efforts have been.
I didn't do anything special.
Take some pride in your achievements.
You've kept the Republic's secrets out of the pirates' hands--and the Empire's. Thanks to you, we can rest easier tonight.
Don't waste my time again.
Glad you think so highly of us. Don't worry, I won't bother you again.
Those computers will be the end of us if the Empire gets a hold of them. I'm glad you're taking care of it.
Where'd they go? Who do I have to shoot to get some sensor data around here?
Sorry, Commander. Latest readings indicate they've established a perimeter around the ships.
I warned the admiral something like this might happen. I hate when I'm right.
Commander? You have visitors.
Perfect timing, Jedi. Those pirates would never see you coming.
Greetings, Captain. I know you've seen your share of pirates, but I could really use a Special Forces team right now.
Hey. You look like you know your way around a blaster. Want a chance to play hero?
We've been caught with our pants down, and I need someone trustworthy who can clean up a mess quickly and quietly.
I am at your service.
How can I help?
You can count on me, Commander. What's the situation?
How can I help?
My calendar's empty at the moment. What do you need?
Sure, why not?
We lost a lot of ships over this hunk of ice, and we always meant to recover their onboard computers. Now we're out of time.
The White Maw pirates are salvaging our machines and selling our data to the highest bidder.
You're putting a lot of stock in someone you just met.
You think I'm "trustworthy"?
You made it to the worst place on Hoth. That takes grit. Besides, I've heard about the work you've been doing.
Doesn't sound like my problem.
I'll be blunt. If the worst happens, this base will be elbow-deep in Imperials before the week is out.
Pirates are salvaging computers out of our wrecked starships. Computers with a lot of sensitive data.
Codes, maneuvers, base locations... if this continues, we can kiss any security we had goodbye.
We have to get to the computers first.
There's no time to waste.
That's the spirit. Never mind that those pirates would kill their own mothers to protect that salvage.
How many squads are securing the area?
What resources do I have?
With enough troops, we could secure the area.
Why not send a full squad?
This will be easy, as long as we have enough troopers.
I'll need a squad for backup.
If we send a bunch of soldiers in there, the pirates will know how valuable those machines are--speed up the operation.
You have any good news?
I heard you liked a challenge.
I need somebody who can be quiet, fast, and if need be, deadly. We need to wipe each computer with an ion mine.
The pirates aren't going to make it easy for you, either. They'd kill their own mothers to protect that salvage.
I'll keep the Republic's secrets safe.
You can trust me.
You have nothing to fear. I can handle this.
I'll take care of it.
Quick and deadly. Sounds perfect for me.
I'm the one for the job, sir.
Oh, I never get tired of shooting pirates. Count me in.
Sure, sounds entertaining.
I knew we could rely on you. Find the ships that still have functional computers and wipe them.
I'm in. Where are the ships?
The ships are scattered around the starship graveyard--you'll have to plant an ion mine on each one.
Good luck! We're all counting on you.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
I should have known better than to ask you. You're as bad as the pirates.
At least we can rely on them to attack us.
The White Maw pirates are on the move again. Keep your head down out there.
